content: <xml>   <records>        <record>       <contributors>         <authors>           <author>Dimogerontakis, Emmanouil</author>           <author>Vilata, Ivan</author>           <author>Navarro, Leandro</author>         </authors>       </contributors>       <titles>         <title>Software Defined Networking for CommunityNetwork Testbeds</title>         <secondary-title/>       </titles>       <doi>10.5281/zenodo.7547</doi>       <pages/>       <volume/>       <number/>       <keywords>         <keyword>CONFINE</keyword>         <keyword>community networks</keyword>         <keyword>software defined networking</keyword>       </keywords>       <dates>         <year>2013</year>         <pub-dates>           <date>2013-10-07</date>         </pub-dates>       </dates>       <abstract><p>Wireless Community Networks have received increasing attention the latest years. In an effort to set the cornerstone for an internet without central authorities and &nbsp;monopolies,&nbsp;network engineers throughout the world have started creating&nbsp;community networks. To enhance this effort, Community-lab,&nbsp;a wireless community networks testbed, was created allowing&nbsp;researchers to experiment with new protocols and applications&nbsp;in a realistic environment. Nevertheless, this testbed does not offer&nbsp;the ability to perform L2 experiments. To address this gap, we&nbsp;developed a platform that allows Community-Lab researchers to&nbsp;perform L2 experiments. Moreover, we decided to reach our goal&nbsp;using Software Defined Networking(SDN) techniques, due to the&nbsp;attention they received lately and their promise for a complete&nbsp;networking solution. Overall, we propose an architecture that&nbsp;allows researchers to perform L2 experiments in a generic&nbsp;community networks testbed. To prove the feasibility of our&nbsp;archtecture we implemented it for Community-Lab using the&nbsp;OpenFlow SDN protocol, enabling researchers to manage the L2&nbsp;topology of their experiments.</p></abstract>     </record>      </records> </xml>
